author: dr.sntntn
content:
Hi everyone! 
I'm Vukasin, a developer with interest in the Ethereum core protocol.
Last week, I was one of the organizers of the Ethereum conference in my country (Serbia), where I first learned about this Protocol Fellowship and the Foundation's work.
I was told that even though the official application period has ended, it's still possible to join through permissionless contributions â€” which I'd love to do!
Alongside this, I'm a Master's student in Computer Science at the Faculty of Mathematics in Belgrade, where I gain strong background in algorithms, analytical thinking, and research.
Since Iâ€™m new here and I understand that the new EPF cohort is starting this Monday, I wanted to ask if I could join and follow along.
Also - to respect the community rules - should I introduce myself to anyone directly (with CV / LinkedIn), or is this message sufficient?
If I can participate, do you already have a list of topics to choose from, or should I propose one myself?
Looking forward to your guidance and to contributing! <:foundation:898330948750426172>
